org.melior.service.mongo

Class MongoRequestInterceptor<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.melior.service.mongo.MongoCollection<T>
      • org.melior.service.mongo.MongoRequestInterceptor<T>

  • public class MongoRequestInterceptor<T>
extends MongoCollection<T>
    Intercepts any managed items that have been added to a MongoDB collection after they have been retrieved by the MongoListener but before they haven been processed, and routes them past the configured WorkManager to allow the WorkManager to control the flow of the items through the application.

    The transaction context is populated with an automatically generated UUID for the duration of processing of the items.

    Since:
    2.3
    Author:
    Melior

    • Method Detail

      • batch

        public MongoCollection<T> batch(org.melior.service.work.BatchProcessor<T> batchProcessor)
        Set batch processor. New arrivals in the collection will be batched and processed together. It is the responsibility of the calling application to ensure that the batch either succeeds atomically or fails atomically.
        Overrides:
        batch in class MongoCollection<T>
        Parameters:
        batchProcessor - The batch processor
        Returns:
        The Mongo collection

      • single

        public MongoCollection<T> single(org.melior.service.work.SingletonProcessor<T> singletonProcessor)
        Set singleton processor. New arrivals in the collection will be processed individually.
        Overrides:
        single in class MongoCollection<T>
        Parameters:
        singletonProcessor - The singleton processor
        Returns:
        The Mongo collection
